## Low Birth Weight

::: {style="padding-bottom:40px"}
Percentage of babies born who weigh under 2,500 grams.
:::

::: {layout="[1, 15]" style="font-size:75%"}
![](images/definition.png){widh="40"}

::: {layout-ncol="2" style="font-size:75%"}
**all** low birth weight live births

low birth weight live **singleton** births that occur **at full term**
:::
:::

::: {layout="[1, 15]" style="font-size:75%"}
![](images/data.png){widh="40"}

::: {layout-ncol="2" style="font-size:75%"}
**IDPH** [Vital Statistics of Iowa Annual Report](https://idph.iowa.gov/health-statistics/data)[^1]

**IDPH** [Iowa Public Health Tracking Portal](https://tracking.idph.iowa.gov/People-Community/reproduction-and-birth/Low-Birthweight/Low-Birthweight-Births-Among-Full-Term-Births)
:::
:::

[^1]: Last report available online is from 2020

## Immunized Children

::: {style="padding-bottom:40px"}
Rate of Iowa's children immunized by age 2.
:::

::: {layout="[1, 15]" style="font-size:75%"}
![](images/data.png){widh="40"}

::: {layout-ncol="2" style="font-size:75%"}
**IDPH** [Iowa Immunization Program Annual Report](https://idph.iowa.gov/immtb/immunization/data-and-reports)[^2] or directly from the [Immunization Registry Information System](https://iris.iowa.gov/IRISPRDJ/clientSearch.do?language=en)

**IDPH** [Iowa Public Health Tracking Portal](https://tracking.idph.iowa.gov/Health/Immunization/Childhood-Immunizations/Childhood-Immunization-Data)[^3]
:::
:::

[^2]: Last report available online is from 2019, although ECI spreadsheet includes values from 2020

[^3]: Our data is in complete agreement with those [reported by IDPH](https://tracking.idph.iowa.gov/Portals/14/userfiles/10/Immunization%20Summaries/2021%20Childhood%20Immunizations%20Data%20Summary.pdf)

![](images/data.png){widh="40"}

## Domestic Violence

::: {style="padding-bottom:40px"}
Domestic abuse rate (per 100,000).
:::

::: {layout="[1, 15]" style="font-size:75%"}
![](images/details.png){widh="40"}

Different *denominator* might be used to estimate total population (**US Census** decennial vs **ACS** 5-year estimates)
:::

::: {layout="[1, 15]" style="font-size:75%"}
![](images/data.png){widh="40"}

Our total number of incidents (*numarator*) do not match with those in ECI spreadsheet, but is in complete agreement with those reported by Iowa DPS on [UCR portal](https://icrime.dps.state.ia.us/CrimeInIowa/Report/DomesticAbuseSummaryReport)[^11]
:::

[^11]: Data in Iowa UCR is only available from 2016.

## Unemployment Rate

::: {style="padding-bottom:40px"}
Percent of unemployed persons.
:::

::: {layout="[1, 15]" style="font-size:75%"}
![](images/details.png){widh="40"}

::: {layout-ncol="2" style="font-size:75%"}
**Unadjusted** counts

**Adjusted** counts[^12]
:::
:::

[^12]: In order to align with ECI's values, our calculation was changed (now based on unadjusted counts).

::: {layout="[1, 15]" style="font-size:75%"}
![](images/data.png){widh="40"}

For some years our percentages do not match with those in ECI spreadsheet, but is in complete agreement with those reported by Iowa WorkForce Development on [the Local Area Unemployment Statistics tool](https://www.iowalmi.gov/local-area-unemployment-statistics)[^13]
:::

[^13]: Data in LAUS tool are often (retroactively) corrected, which might be a cause for observed differences.

## Children in Poverty

::: {style="padding-bottom:40px"}
Percent of children under six years of age living in poverty (families with incomes below 100% of the U.S. poverty threshold).
:::

::: {layout="[1, 15]" style="font-size:75%"}
![](images/details.png){widh="40"}

Different *denominator* might be used to estimate total number of children under 6
:::

::: {layout="[1, 15]" style="font-size:75%"}
![](images/data.png){widh="40"}

::: {layout-ncol="2" style="font-size:75%"}
**US Census** decennial data[^14]

**ACS** 5-year estimates
:::
:::

[^14]: ECI gets the indicator from [Kids Count Data Center](http://www.datacenter.kidscount.org/), instead of getting data directly from the ACS.

## Children with Health Coverage by Income Level

::: {style="padding-bottom:40px"}
Number and percent of minor children with health coverage by income and poverty level[^15]
:::

[^15]: This is a new indicator, no previous data exist from ECI

::: {layout="[1, 15]" style="font-size:75%"}
![](images/details.png){widh="40"}

**Poverty level** should be explicitly defined (SAHIE reports this data for 6 diffrent levels of poverty: \<= 138%, \<= 200%, \<= 250%, \<= 400%, 138% to 400%, and all incomes)[^16]
:::

[^16]: Our indicator currently is based on \<= 200% of Poverty.

## All People in Poverty

::: {style="padding-bottom:40px"}
Percent of people living in poverty[^17]^,^[^18]
:::

[^17]: This is a new indicator, no previous data exist from ECI

[^18]: Unlike other similar indicators this one, according to [**ECI Tool K(B)**](https://earlychildhood.iowa.gov/sites/default/files/documents/2021-11/Tool%20K%28B%29%20as%20of%2011-5-21.doc.pdf){preview-link="true" style="text-align: center"}, should be normalized using ACS 5-year estimates.

## Homelessness Count

::: {style="padding-bottom:40px"}
Sheltered and unsheltered point in time counts of homeless individuals[^19]
:::

[^19]: This is a new indicator, no previous data exist from ECI

## Availability of Child Care

::: {style="padding-bottom:40px"}
Number of "slots" or "spaces" potentially available for a child in a licensed or registered setting.
:::

::: {layout="[1, 15]" style="font-size:75%"}
![](images/data.png){widh="40"}

::: {layout-ncol="2" style="font-size:75%"}
**DHS** DCPDMAST Report

**Iowa CCR&R** [Data Sheets](https://iowaccrr.org/data/)
:::
:::

## Working Parents

::: {style="padding-bottom:40px"}
Percent of children under 6 years with all parents in the labor force.
:::

::: {layout="[1, 15]" style="font-size:75%"}
![](images/details.png){widh="40"}

Different *denominator*[^20] might be used to estimate total number of children under six (**US Census** decennial vs **ACS** 5-year estimates)
:::

[^20]: Denominator is not defined in the Tool K(B)

::: {layout="[1, 15]" style="font-size:75%"}
![](images/data.png){widh="40"}

Our percentages from 2009 to 2014 do not match with those in ECI spreadsheet
:::

## Quality Early Learning Environments

::: {style="padding-bottom:40px"}
Number of quality early learning environments that are NAEYC (National Association for the Education of Young Children) or NAFCC (National Association of Family Child Care) accredited and/or meet Head Start program performance standards, and/or verified QPPS sites, and/or have achieved a QRS level 4-5.
:::

::: {layout="[1, 15]" style="font-size:75%"}
![](images/data.png){widh="40"}

::: {layout-ncol="2" style="font-size:75%"}
**ECI** Annual Report

**QRS**\
**NAEYC**
:::
:::

## Health and Dental Providers who Accept Medicaid

::: {style="padding-bottom:40px"}
Number of Dentists (general) and Pediatricians (specialization) that accept Medicaid for services.
:::
